alerts.headline: weather advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Winter weather travel advisory in effect.

What:
Snowfall with total accumulations near 10 cm. 
Reduced visibility in heavy snow and local blowing snow. 

When:
Beginning overnight into Tuesday night.

Additional information:
Rain will change to snow overnight and continue through Tuesday. Gusty northwest winds will develop Tuesday morning leading to reduced visibility in areas of blowing snow.

###

Travel may be hazardous due to sudden changes in the weather.

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Be prepared to adjust your driving with changing road conditions. Slow down driving in slippery conditions. Watch for taillights ahead and maintain a safe following distance.

alerts.headline: weather advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Winter weather travel advisory in effect.

What:
Snowfall with total accumulations of 5 to 10 cm, possibly exceeding 10 cm for some areas.
Reduced visibility in heavy snow and local blowing snow. 

When:
Tonight, continuing into Tuesday.

Additional information:
Rain will change to snow late this evening. Gusty northwest winds will develop tonight leading to reduced visibility in areas of blowing snow.

###

Travel may be hazardous due to sudden changes in the weather.

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Be prepared to adjust your driving with changing road conditions. Slow down driving in slippery conditions. Watch for taillights ahead and maintain a safe following distance.

alerts.headline: special weather statement in effect
alerts.description:
Heavy snow expected.

What:
Total snowfall accumulations of 10 to 20 cm.
Reduced visibility in heavy snow and local blowing snow.

When:
Continuing through this evening.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

alerts.headline: special weather statement in effect
alerts.description:
Heavy snow expected.

What:
Total snowfall accumulations of 10 to 15 cm.
Reduced visibility in heavy snow and local blowing snow.

When:
This afternoon into Wednesday morning.

Additional information:
Rain will transition to snow this morning before becoming heavier this afternoon.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

alerts.headline: snowfall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 25 cm is expected.

What:
Reduced visibility in heavy snow and local blowing snow.
Peak snowfall rates of 2 to 3 cm per hour. 

When:
Tapering off later this morning.

###

Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Be prepared to adjust your driving with changing road conditions.

alerts.instruction: Prepare for quickly changing and deteriorating travel conditions.

alerts.headline: snowfall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 25 cm is expected.

What:
Peak snowfall rates of 2 to 3 cm per hour. 
Reduced visibility in heavy snow.

When:
Continuing through late this afternoon. 

Additional information:
Snow, heavy at times will mainly impact the community of Ogoki Post. The axis of heaviest snow is expected to cover a swath from near Armstrong, to Ogoki Post and northeast towards James Bay.

###

Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

alerts.headline: weather advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Winter weather travel advisory in effect.

What:
Snowfall with total accumulations near 10 cm.
Reduced visibility in heavy snow and local blowing snow. 

When:
Today into tonight.

Additional information:
Snow will continue today with gusty northwest winds will developing this morning leading to reduced visibility in areas of blowing snow.

###

Travel may be hazardous due to sudden changes in the weather.

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Be prepared to adjust your driving with changing road conditions. Slow down driving in slippery conditions. Watch for taillights ahead and maintain a safe following distance. If visibility is reduced while driving, turn on your lights and maintain a safe following distance.
